title: Cat. 46 Salts, 1851/55
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Charters, Cann & Dunn (American, 1848–c. 1855)  
Retailed by Ball, Black & Co. (American, 1851–1876)  
New York, New York  
Silver; 5.7 × 8.3 cm (2 1/4 × 3 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Glen Ellyn-Wheaton Associates of The Woman’s Board of The Art Institute of Chicago, 1977.45a-b

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 46.1 and fig. 46.2)

Engraved on side of each: EJD (fig. 46.3)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Antique Silver Shop, Marshall Field & Co., Chicago, by 1977.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1977.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Naeve (1977), p. 5, fig. 6 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Salts, 1851/55.

fig. 46.1 fig. 46.3 fig. 46.2 </section>
